#summary pixmap widget definition

= pixmap widget =
----
== Definition ==
{{{
<pixmap tag_attr="value" tag_attr="value" ...>
	<variable>varname</variable>
	<height>value</height>
	<width>value</width>
	<input file stock="gtk-imagename"></input>
	<input file>filename</input>
	<visible>state</visible>
</pixmap>
}}}
----
== Tag Attributes ==
These are [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkImage.html#GtkImage.object-hierarchy GtkImage] widget or ancestor class properties and I recommend tracing through the object hierarchy to locate the tag attributes available for this widget.
----
== Directives ==
|| *Name* || *Description* || *Value* || *Mandatory* || *Introduced* ||
|| variable || Shell variable name || || || ||
|| height || Scaling dimension || Positive value, -1 to ignore || || 0.7.21 ||
|| width || Scaling dimension || Positive value, -1 to ignore || || 0.7.21 ||
|| input file stock="gtk-imagename" || Stock GTK image name || [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/gtk-Stock-Items.html#GTK-STOCK-ABOUT:CAPS gtk-about, gtk-add, gtk-apply, gtk-bold...] || (O) || ||
|| input file || Image filename || || (O) || ||
|| visible || Sensitive state || enabled or disabled || || ||
